title: Franz Kafka. The Metamorphosis and Other Stories. Read by George
description:
Franz Kafka. The Metamorphosis and Other Stories. Read by George Guidall

Franz Kafka 
- The Metamorphosis & Other Stories
- George Guidall, Narrator
- Joachim Neugroschel, Translator 
- Unabridged
- 6 Tapes = 8 Hrs 45 Mins
- Recorded Books
- 1995

In the bizarre world of Franz Kafka, salesmen turn 
into giant bugs, apes give lectures at college academies, 
and nightmares probe the mysteries of modern humanityÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s 
unhappiness. More than any other modern writer in world 
literature, Kafka captures the loneliness and misery that 
fill the lives of 20th-century humanity. The Metamorphosis 
and Other Stories reveals the authorÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s extraordinary 
talent in a variety of formsÃ¢â‚¬â€prose poems, short stories, 
sketches, allegories, and novelettesÃ¢â‚¬â€and showcases the 
straightÃ¢â‚¬â€œfaced humor, startling psychological insight, 
and haunting imagination for which he is revered as a 
modern master. 

In this brilliant new translation, prizeÃ¢â‚¬â€œwinning translator 
Joachim Neugroschel preserves the delicate balance, rich 
timbre, and wondrous language of KafkaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s original works. 

This collection includes 

- An Introduction
- Conversation with the worshiper 
- Conversation with the drunk 
- Great noise 
- Children on the highway
- Exposing a city slicker 
- The sudden stroll 
- Decisions
- The outing in the mountains
- The bachelor's unhappiness 
- The businessman 
- Absently gazing out 
- The way home 
- The people running by 
- The passenger
- Frocks
- The rejection
- Reflections for amateur jockeys
- The window facing the street
- The wish to be an Indian
- The trees
- Unhappiness
- The judgment
- The stoker
- The metamorphosis
- The new lawyer
- An ancient manuscript 
- Jackals and Arabs
- A fratricide
- A dream
- A report for an academy
- In the penal colony
